questions.question: Commander window and ___________________ are the parts of MSWLogo Window.
_____________ are the commands in MSWLogo.
File option is present in _________ bar of MSWLogo.
The _________ button permanently stops the execution of commands.
The ________ button executes the command typed in the command input box.
The process of removing mistakes from the commands is called ___________
_________ is the pointed top of the turtle.
Which button finds the errors in the commands?
This button clears the screen and places the turtle in the centre of the screen.
What do you need to type in the input box to exit MSWLogo?
Which part of MSWLogo is where the turtle is seen?
Where are all the commands typed in MSWLogo?
Which button in MSWLogo finds the errors in the program?
Which button clears the Main Screen and places the turtle back in the centre?
Which button executes the command typed in the command input box?
What are primitives?
options: Built-in commands in MSWLogo that perform specific functions
The basic shapes that can be drawn in MSWLogo
Additional tools that can be downloaded for MSWLogo
The color palette options available in the drawing area
questions.answer: Built-in commands in MSWLogo that perform specific functions

questions.question: What is the shape of MSWLogo turtle?
Why is the turtle called the pen of the logo?
options: Because it leaves a trail like a pen when it moves
Because it was originally designed to look like a pen
Because it can be lifted up or put down like a real pen
Because the original Logo creator owned a turtle-shaped pen
questions.answer: Because it leaves a trail like a pen when it moves

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the Main Screen in MSWLogo?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the Commander Window in MSWLogo?
What are the two ways to exit MSWLogo?
options: Click 'File' and then 'Exit', or type 'Bye' and click Execute
Press Alt+F4, or type 'Quit' and click Execute
Click 'File' and then 'Close', or type 'Exit' and click Execute
Right-click the title bar and select 'Close', or type 'Stop' and click Execute
questions.answer: Click 'File' and then 'Exit', or type 'Bye' and click Execute

questions.question: The ____________ command is used to move the turtle forwards with the specified number of steps.
The ______ command is used to move the turtle backward with the specified number of steps.
RT 90 will turn the turtle to ___________ by 90 steps.
LT 50 will turn the turtle to ________________ by 50 steps.
The ________ command is used to bring the MSWLogo turtle back to the drawing mode.
Which MSWLogo command turns the turtle in the clockwise direction?
Which MSWLogo command is used to draw invisible lines?
Which MSWLogo command is used to erase unwanted lines?
Which MSWLogo command changes pen size?
Which MSWLogo command changes pen colour?
Which MSWLogo command erases drawing and background?
What is the relationship between PU and PD commands in MSWLogo?
options: PU lifts the pen to draw invisible lines, PD puts the pen down to draw visible lines
PU moves the turtle up, PD moves the turtle down
PU prints text upward, PD prints text downward
PU powers up the turtle, PD powers down the turtle
questions.answer: PU lifts the pen to draw invisible lines, PD puts the pen down to draw visible lines

questions.question: What is the relationship between HT and ST commands in MSWLogo?
options: HT sets the turtle to home position, ST sets the turtle to start position
HT handles text input, ST shows text output
HT hides the turtle, ST shows the turtle
HT halts the turtle movement, ST starts the turtle movement
questions.answer: HT hides the turtle, ST shows the turtle

questions.question: What is the relationship between PE and PPT commands in MSWLogo?
options: PE erases lines, PPT draws lines
PE powers the engine, PPT pauses the turtle
PE prints errors, PPT prints text
PE performs equations, PPT plots points
questions.answer: PE erases lines, PPT draws lines

questions.question: What does the SETSCREENCOLOR command do in MSWLogo?
options: Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen
Erases text in the Recall List Box
Changes background colour of the screen
questions.answer: Changes background colour of the screen

questions.question: What does the FORWARD command do in MSWLogo?
options: Erases text in the Recall List Box

questions.question: What does the SETPENSIZE command do in MSWLogo?
options: Changes background colour of the screen
Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen

questions.question: What does the CLEANTEXT command do in MSWLogo?
options: Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen
Changes background colour of the screen
Erases text in the Recall List Box
questions.answer: Erases text in the Recall List Box

questions.question: What does the SETH command do in MSWLogo?
options: Erases text in the Recall List Box
Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen

questions.question: What does the HOME command do in MSWLogo?
options: Changes background colour of the screen
Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen
Erases text in the Recall List Box
questions.answer: Brings the turtle to the centre of the screen

questions.question: The ___________ contains buttons for the commonly used options such as Save, Undo and Redo.
________ is the default file name of the few new document.
The __________ shows the page margins.
________ is the extension of the file save in Microsoft Word.
Press Ctrl + S to ________ a document.
The number of scroll bars in Word 2016 document are ___________
Which of the following keys will you press to open a document?
What is the vertical line that appears in the Work Area called?
Where do you find Maximize button in Word 2016?
Which view gives the various options to save, open, print and share files in Word 2016?
Which of the following is NOT a component of Microsoft Word Window?
options: Quick Access Toolbar with common commands
Command Prompt for entering text commands
questions.answer: Command Prompt for entering text commands

questions.question: What is a cursor in Microsoft Word?
options: A blinking vertical line that shows where text will appear when you type
A tool used to measure margins and page dimensions
The mouse pointer icon that changes based on the task
A horizontal line that shows the end of a paragraph
questions.answer: A blinking vertical line that shows where text will appear when you type

questions.question: Which information is NOT typically displayed on the Status Bar in Word 2016?
Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps to open an existing document in Word 2016?
options: Click Home tab > Select Open > Browse files > Select document > Click Open
Click File tab > Select Open > Browse files > Select document > Click Open
Click Edit tab > Select Open > Browse files > Select document > Click Open
Click View tab > Select Open > Browse files > Select document > Click Open
questions.answer: Click File tab > Select Open > Browse files > Select document > Click Open

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct sequence of steps to close a document in Word 2016?
options: Click the X button on the Title Bar of the document window
Press Alt+F4 to close the document
All of the above are correct methods
questions.answer: All of the above are correct methods

questions.question: What will happen if you click the File tab and then select the Save as option in the drop-down list?
options: The document will be saved with its current name
A dialog box will appear allowing you to save the document with a new name or in a different location
The document will be automatically saved to OneDrive
The document will be saved and closed
questions.answer: A dialog box will appear allowing you to save the document with a new name or in a different location

questions.question: What will happen if you follow these steps: Click File tab > Select New > Click Blank document > Type content > Click close button on Title Bar?
options: The document will close without saving and you will lose your content
The document will be automatically saved with a default name
A dialog box will appear asking if you want to save the document before closing
questions.answer: A dialog box will appear asking if you want to save the document before closing

questions.question: To delete a paragraph, select the paragraph and then press ________key.
When you start typing, the text appears where the blinking _________ is located.
In the Home tab, the ___________ group contains the cut, copy and paste options.
Press Ctrl + Z to ______ a command.
Press Ctrl + Y to __________ a command.
Pressing Shift + _________ will select the text till the beginning.
Shortcut key to cut the selected text in a document is:
To paste text, you press:
In which color is the selected text highlighted?
Where do you find Undo and Redo buttons?
Why do you need to select text in Microsoft Word?
options: To specify which text you want to format, copy, cut, or delete
To increase the font size automatically
To check spelling and grammar only in that section
To lock that section from being edited
questions.answer: To specify which text you want to format, copy, cut, or delete

questions.question: What is the difference between Cut and Copy commands?
options: Cut removes the selected text from its original location while Copy keeps the original text in place
Cut can only be used once while Copy can be used multiple times
Cut is only for text while Copy works for text and images
Cut is for moving text to another document while Copy is for moving text within the same document
questions.answer: Cut removes the selected text from its original location while Copy keeps the original text in place

questions.question: If you want to repeat the last action by using a command, which command will you use?
Which of the following is NOT a command in the Clipboard group?
What is the shortcut key to open Print pane in Word?
